name: Channel evolution model stage (I-VI)
functionStatement: Long-term changes in channel size and slope maintain dynamic equilibrium and diverse habitats while interacting with the floodplain.
descriptionMarkdown: Channel is stable/recovered (Stage I/VI or 0,1,6,8), not actively degrading, unless partial evolution is normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess channel evolution stage using field indicators or recent geomorphic reports. Use desktop review only for coarse screening.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Stable or re-stabilized channel (Stage I or VI).

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Actively widening or incising (often Stage III-IV).

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Severe incision or destructive phases (often Stage II or severe III-IV).
